translated: Then eat of it with the other end, with that end whereby the ancient Rishis ate of it. 'Thy offspring will die from the eldest downwards,' he says to him. translated: Then eat him with the other two ears with which the Rishis of old ate him. Thou wilt become deaf,' he says to him. I did not eat him with the ears turned towards me, nor with the ears turned away from me, nor with the ears turned crosswise. With the ears of heaven and earth I ate him. With them I approached him. translated: Then eat him with two other eyes, with which the Rishis of old ate him. 'Thou wilt become blind,' he says to him. I did not eat him with an eye turned towards me, nor with an eye turned away, nor with an eye turned hither and thither. With the sun and moon as eyes, with them I ate him, with them I conquered him. translated: Then eat of it with the other side, with that by which the ancient Rishis ate it. 'The lightning will strike thee,' he says to him. translated: Then thou mayest eat him with the other side of thy breast, with which the ancient Rishis ate him. 'Thou shalt not be deprived of the fruit of thy husbandry,' he says to him. I have eaten him, I have conquered him, with that side of my breast which is neither turned towards nor away from nor opposite the earth. This is the whole-limbed, whole-skinned, whole-bodied rice.
